unnormalised: New research from AIIMS Delhi suggests that early diagnosis is key in managing neurological disorders. A recent study published on 20/07/2024 highlights the importance of recognizing subtle symptoms like persistent headaches, dizziness, and unexplained numbness. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, lead researcher, emphasized that "timely intervention can significantly improve patient outcomes."
normalised: New research from A-I-I-M-S Delhi suggests that early diagnosis is key in managing neurological disorders. A recent study published on twentieth July two thousand and twenty four highlights the importance of recognizing subtle symptoms like persistent headaches, dizziness, and unexplained numbness. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, lead researcher, emphasized that "timely intervention can significantly improve patient outcomes."

unnormalised: The study followed 500 patients aged 30-60 yrs with varying neurological conditions, from migraines to more serious issues like multiple sclerosis and Parkinson’s. A significant finding was that patients who sought medical attention within 6 months of experiencing initial symptoms showed better responses to treatment. Apparently, that window of opportunity is pretty crucial, guys!
normalised: The study followed five hundred patients aged thirty to sixty years with varying neurological conditions, from migraines to more serious issues like multiple sclerosis and Parkinson's. A significant finding was that patients who sought medical attention within six months of experiencing initial symptoms showed better responses to treatment. Apparently, that window of opportunity is pretty crucial, guys!

unnormalised: "Many people tend to ignore minor aches and pains, attributing them to stress or fatigue," says Dr. Sharma, a neurologist at Max Hospital. "But especially if these symptoms are persistent or worsening, it's crucial to consult a specialist. A simple neurological exam, costing around Rs. 2500, could make all the difference."
normalised: "Many people tend to ignore minor aches and pains, attributing them to stress or fatigue," says Doctor Sharma, a neurologist at Max Hospital. "But especially if these symptoms are persistent or worsening, it's crucial to consult a specialist. A simple neurological exam, costing around rupee two thousand five hundred, could make all the difference."

unnormalised: One area of particular focus was the increasing prevalence of stroke among younger adults (under 45 yrs). Factors like high blood pressure, diabetes, and smoking were identified as major risk factors. The team at AIIMS recommends regular check-ups, especially for those with a family history of neurological diseases.
normalised: One area of particular focus was the increasing prevalence of stroke among younger adults (under forty five years). Factors like high blood pressure, diabetes, and smoking were identified as major risk factors. The team at A-I-I-M-S recommends regular check-ups, especially for those with a family history of neurological diseases.

unnormalised: So, folks, don't ignore those niggling symptoms! Prepone that appointment with your GP and get things checked out. It’s better to be safe than sorry, right? Plus, you can always grab a samosa and chai afterwards to reward yourself for being proactive about your health. You know, just saying!
normalised: So, folks, don't ignore those niggling symptoms! Prepone that appointment with your G-P and get things checked out. It's better to be safe than sorry, right? Plus, you can always grab a samosa and chai afterwards to reward yourself for being proactive about your health. You know, just saying!
